required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The GENPET Study - An Imaging Study of FCH-PET-CT in Men With Prostate Cancer and a BRCA Gene Mutation.
clinical_study.official_title: An Imaging Study of FCH-PET-CT in Men With Prostate Cancer and a BRCA Gene Mutation (GENPET)

lead_sponsor.agency: Institute of Cancer Research, United Kingdom

collaborator.agency: National Institute for Health Research, United Kingdom

clinical_study.source: Institute of Cancer Research, United Kingdom

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study is to determine if FCH-PET-CT imaging is superior to combined bone scan and MRI/CT of the abdomen & pelvis in detecting the increased incidence of metastasis (nodal/distant outside the pelvis) in men with prostatic carcinoma with germline BRCA mutations.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Within 12 months of the last FCH-PET-CT scan
primary_outcome.description: To determine if the sensitivity of FCH-PET-CT is superior to combined conventional imaging (MRI (T2 and T1 weighted)/CT and bone scan) in detecting nodal and distant (outside the pelvis) metastases in BRCA1/2 germline mutation carriers with prostate cancer.

secondary_outcome.measure: 2. Outline the Specificity of the FCH-PET-CT scan
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 12 months of the last FCH-PET-CT scan
secondary_outcome.description: determining the positive predictive value (PPV) and negative predictive value (NPV) in detecting metastatic disease in BRCA mutation carriers with prostate cancer

secondary_outcome.measure: 3.Incidence and sites of additional metastases identified on FCH-PET-CT compared with combined MRI/bone scan.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 12 months of the last FCH-PET-CT scan

secondary_outcome.measure: 4.To measure the impact of FCH-PET-CT findings in changing patient management and in clinical decision making
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 12 months of the last FCH-PET-CT scan

other_outcome.measure: To investigate the rate of incidentally detected second primary tumours in BRCA mutation carriers with prostate cancer
other_outcome.time_frame: Within 12 months of the last FCH-PET-CT scan

other_outcome.measure: To investigate the prognostic significance of FCH-PET-CT findings (e.g. employing standard SUV parameters and heterogeneity of PET texture of the primary prostate tumour)
other_outcome.time_frame: Within 12 months of the last FCH-PET-CT scan

other_outcome.measure: To assess agreement between imaging readers in assessing FCH-PET-CT scans.
other_outcome.time_frame: Within 12 months of the last FCH-PET-CT scan

arm_group.description: Newly diagnosed with prostate cancer (any Gleason score, any stage, any PSA) Biochemically progressing patients who were treated radically with surgery or radiotherapy (more than 6 months ago) and are currently not receiving hormonal treatment or chemotherapy Patients on active surveillance, with a PSA doubling time of 6 months or less

intervention.description: Individuals to undergo a MRI or CT scan of Pelvis
intervention.other_name: Magnetic resonance imaging or computerized axial tomography

intervention.description: bone scan of the whole body.

intervention.other_name: 18F Choline positron emission tomography /computerized axial tomography

study_pop.textblock: Any patient that meets the eligibility criteria and a patient at the Royal Marsden Hospital.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Confirmed pathogenic germline mutation in either BRCA1 or BRCA2
- Over the age of 18
- Diagnosed with prostate cancer and at a time when staging imaging is clinically indicated; either:
- At a new diagnosis
- Biochemically progressing patients who were treated radically with surgery or radiotherapy (more than 6 months ago) and are currently not receiving hormonal treatment or chemotherapy
- Patients on active surveillance with a PSA doubling time of 6 months or less
Exclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of other malignancy (excluding basal cell cancer/squamous cell cancer of the skin) within five years of diagnosis
- Known metastatic prostate cancer, both local and distant
- Patients who have received any oncological treatment within the last six months
- Patients on any investigational drug treatment
- Patients on steroids
- Known history of inflammatory/infective diseases (e.g. sarcoidosis, tuberculosis, inflammatory bowel disease)
- Contraindications to having an MRI using the standard MRI checklist (e.g. pacemakers, aneurysm clips, claustrophobia)

overall_official.affiliation: Institute of Cancer Research and Royal Marsden Hospital

facility.name: Cancer Genetics Unit, Royal Marsden Hospital

contact.last_name: Rosalind Eeles, MA; PhD; FRCP; FRCR; FMedSci

patient_data.ipd_description: Anonymised data may be applied for via the Study Team
